steps.title: Tuck the brim under the beret.
steps.content: Tuck the brim under the beret. Every beret has a brim that fits snug on your head and holds the beret in place. Tuck the brim up and under the excess fabric of the beret. Then puff out the fabric of the beret so it hides the edge of the beret. Tilt the beret to 1 side, with the front of the beret pulled down to your eyebrow. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Create volume with your beret.
steps.content: Create volume with your beret. Keep the brim tight against your head, and tilt the beret slightly to one side. Then pull gently on the top of the beret so the fabric pulls away from your head. This should create space between the top of your head and the top of your beret, rather than it sitting flat against your head. [2] X Research source You can also smooth down the part of the beret that sits over your ear for a variation of this look.

steps.title: Pin the beret to the back of your head.
steps.content: Pin the beret to the back of your head. Place the beret at the crown of your head and secure it with bobby pins around the brim. How many bobby pins you need will depend on how thick your hair is, but placing 1 every 1 in (2.5 cm) is a good place to start. Pull the fabric at the front of the beret very gently so that the beret shows just above the top of your hair. [3] X Research source Create more height in your beret by rolling up a silk scarf and stuffing it in the front of the beret. Then pin the beret on.

steps.title: Tilt the beret to one side.
steps.content: Tilt the beret to one side. The trim of the beret should make about a 45-degree angle across your forehead. If you part your hair on the side of your head, tilt your beret in the opposite direction for contrast. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Straighten your hair if it will show under your beret.
steps.content: Straighten your hair if it will show under your beret. The classic beret look calls for straight hair hanging under your beret. It doesn’t matter what length your hair is, as long as at least part of it peeks out from under the beret. Straighten your hair and then brush it out. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use your curls to balance your beret.
steps.content: Use your curls to balance your beret. Having curly hair doesn't mean you can't wear a beret. Simply use your fingers to fluff out the curls on the side of your head opposite to the beret’s tilt. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid high hairstyles.
steps.content: Avoid high hairstyles. High ponytails, buns, or braids can warp the shape of your beret. If you're planning on wearing one, avoid those hairstyles. Instead, opt for low ponytails and braids, or just wear your hair loose!

steps.title: Choose a knit beret for a comfortable, casual look.
steps.content: Choose a knit beret for a comfortable, casual look. Knit berets – whether made from wool or cotton – are super comfy. Because they also look very casual, you can pair 1 with your most casual looks. Choose a knit beret and style it your favorite way. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Use a leather beret for a modern twist.
steps.content: Use a leather beret for a modern twist. A leather – as opposed to knit – beret will make this classic style look more modern. Simply choose a leather (or faux leather) beret and style it the same way. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select a cotton beret for everyday wear.
steps.content: Select a cotton beret for everyday wear. If you want to incorporate a beret into your everyday outfit, pick one made from cotton. It will be casual enough for everyday wear, but not so casual that it clashes with whatever you're wearing.

steps.title: Pick a lined beret to wear in cold weather.
steps.content: Pick a lined beret to wear in cold weather. Lined berets will have a thin layer of material inside of the hat. They'll keep your head warmer than an unlined beret, which makes them a perfect choice for cold weather.

steps.title: Choose an unlined beret to wear in warm weather.
steps.content: Choose an unlined beret to wear in warm weather. As the weather gets warmer, you can swap out your lined beret for one without lining. You'll be able to maintain your look without your head getting sweaty in the heat!

steps.title: Choose a camel beret with dark clothing.
steps.content: Choose a camel beret with dark clothing. A black jacket or sweater paired with a camel-colored beret will create a great sense of contrast. This is an especially great look if you have light to medium brown hair. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Match your beret to your coat.
steps.content: Match your beret to your coat. Berets are usually a cold weather accessory, so you’re likely to be wearing a coat along with your beret. Pull your look together by matching the color of your beret to the color of your coat. You can match colors exactly, or just use similar shades. [10] X Research source For example, you can pair a bright red beret and coat together. Or you can pair a blue coat with blue beret in a lighter shade.

steps.title: Wear a brightly colored beret for a pop of color.
steps.content: Wear a brightly colored beret for a pop of color. An unexpected bright, bold color can add just the right amount of pop to an outfit. You’ll get the most impact if you pair a bright beret with muted, neutral tones, but you pair your bold beret with similar colors in your clothing. [11] X Research source For example, if you're wearing an all-black or neutral outfit, add a bright red beret.

steps.title: Match your beret to your hair color.
steps.content: Match your beret to your hair color. If you’re planning on wearing your beret regularly, matching it your hair color ensures that it always looks coordinated. Blondes should choose white or beige berets, brunettes should choose brown berets, and anyone with black hair should choose black berets.

steps.title: Wear a beret with a feminine outfit.
steps.content: Wear a beret with a feminine outfit. Matching the beret with a feminine look makes the beret itself look more feminine. You can match the color of your beret to your outfit, or use contrasting colors. [12] X Research source For example, you can pair your beret with a billowy dress and flats, or a delicate blouse and heels.

steps.title: Pair a beret with an oversized sweater.
steps.content: Pair a beret with an oversized sweater. The slouchiness of a beret matches an oversized sweater well. Pair them with slim pants and flats shoes to balance your outfit. [13] X Research source For example, you can pair a cream-colored beret with an oversized cream-colored sweat and black skinny jeans or leggings.
